name: Spearphishing Attachment
description: Adversaries send spearphishing emails with malicious attachments to gain access.

name: Spearphishing Link
description: Adversaries send spearphishing emails with malicious links to deliver payloads.

name: Spearphishing via Service
description: Adversaries send spearphishing emails via third-party services like SharePoint, Teams, or Google Drive.

name: Spearphishing Voice
description: Adversaries use phone calls (vishing) from attackers claiming to be technical support or executives.

name: Phishing for Information
description: Adversaries send spearphishing emails to gather information (BEC) rather than deliver malware.

name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
description: Adversaries spoof display names or use lookalike domains to appear as legitimate senders.

name: Valid Accounts: Cloud Accounts
description: Adversaries send phishing emails from legitimate compromised cloud accounts (onmicrosoft.com, gmail.com).

name: Compromised Accounts: Email Accounts
description: Adversaries send emails from hacked vendor or colleague accounts for supply chain attacks.

name: Obfuscated Files or Information
description: Adversaries hide text, use zero-width spaces, or white-on-white text to evade analysis.

name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol Impersonation
description: Adversaries create fake system notifications or quarantine alerts to induce user actions.

name: User Execution: Malicious Link
description: The specific button or link the user is urged to click to execute the attack.

name: User Execution: Malicious File
description: The specific file the user is urged to open to execute the attack.
